cpu.description: The amount of CPU that Mesos shall allocate to the scheduler.

ram.description: The amount of RAM that Mesos shall allocate to the scheduler.

image.description: The docker scheduler image to use.

java-heap.description: The java heap space environmental variables to pass to the scheduler

java-home.description: When starting in jar mode, if java is not on the path, you can specify the path here. [JAR MODE ONLY].

use-ip-address.description: If true, the framework will resolve the local ip address. If false, it uses the hostname.

data-directory.description: The data directory used by Docker volumes in the executors.

image.description: The docker executor image to use.

binary-url.description: The elasticsearch binary to use (Must be tar.gz format). [JAR MODE ONLY]

cpu.description: The amount of CPU resource to allocate to the elasticsearch instance.

disk.description: The amount of Disk resource to allocate to the elasticsearch instance (MB).

ram.description: The amount of ram that Mesos shall give give to the executors.

instances.description: The number of elasticsearch nodes to be instantiated. It is recommended that you provide an odd number, to prevent split brain issues.

settings-location.description: Path or URL to ES yml settings file. Path example: '/var/lib/mesos/config/elasticsearch.yml'. URL example: 'https://gist.githubusercontent.com/mmaloney/5e1da5daa58b70a3a671/raw/elasticsearch.yml'. In Docker mode a volume will be created from /tmp/config in the container to the directory that contains elasticsearch.yml.

force-pull-image.description: Option to force pull the executor image. [DOCKER MODE ONLY].

name.description: The name given to the executor task.

external-volume-driver.description: This defines the use of an external storage driver to be used. By default, elasticsearch nodes will not be created with external volumes but rather direct attached storage.

external-volume-options.description: This describes how volumes are to be created.

failover-timeout.description: The time before Mesos kills a scheduler and tasks if it has not recovered (ms).

force-pull-image.description: Forces docker to re-pull the image.

framework-role.description: Used to group frameworks for allocation decisions, depending on the allocation policy being used.

framework-use-docker.description: The framework will use docker if true, or jar files if false. If false, the user must ensure that the scheduler jar is available to all slaves.

port.description: The port number of the ES-Mesos management front-end. Defaults to 8080.

zookeeper-mesos-timeout.description: The timeout for connecting to zookeeper for Mesos (ms).

master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. This should point to the Mesos ZNode on the Zookeeper machine.
